review: Follow up:I still am finding this little device to be useful.  However, since my Samsung TV in my home office has a Amazon and Netflix shortcut button I will not be getting another.  I currently am using this one device on an older samsung plasma that only has yahoo widgets and not direct shortcuts too these two major services.First impressions.  Great.  It comes already synced with my account...just like Kindles.  It needs to run a major update so don't get too comfortable.  You will need to either join it to your wireless or plug in the ethernet cable let the update run and then rejoin to your home network.Once this is done you are set.  The user interface is intuitive and requires a very short learning curve.I like the way my library and saved lists are displayed.I am just putting in my two cents worth here.  There are so many reviews so if you want to read an epistle you can do so.I for one prefer short and sweet.It is easy to use, hardware is nice, lookup function with the microphone is amazing and finds what you want!They have a lot of channels available and most cost extra.Compare and contrast to my apple tv.  Two very different devices yet they have a lot in common.I paid $99 for this and $99 a year for amazon prime. On my apple tv I paid $93 and that is it.  I watch a number of things that may or may not be on amazon.  I am used to watching them on apple tv and since i am heavily invested in the iTunes system with around 1.5 terabyte of videos, tv show, movies and music I will be keeping it.  I also watch sky news, youtube videos and MLB on the apple.  I of course have to pay $118 a year for MLB.So if you already are a prime customer this makes perfect sense.  It is hands above the roku device.
author: ILUVmyGrandKids

review: Set up was a breeze and I was on line in less than 5 minutes. Entering my network password took longer than plugging it in. This thing is so small you can put it anywhere and most people won't even see it.It is fast and the up scanning options are fantastic.  Wireless is fast enough to get good HD video on local or internet files.I like it!
author: Donald J Buteau

review: I have never owned a setup box like this before, no Apple TV, No Roku etc.  I have seen the others at friends houses and just didn't like the user experience..anyway.  Gave this one a try, don't really like it.  First, I have a trail Prime Membership and I can't tell 1/2 the time if the movie/tv episode is something I get for free or if I have to pay.  They make you dig down into the menu and select "Amazon Prime".  So, you have to go through this for every thing you think you may want to watch just to check to see if you need to pay or not.  Speaking of paying, every single movie, episode has the pay link front and center, if you are entitled to watch it for free with your Prime Membership.  It is like Amazon, is trying to trick us into paying for something we don't need to...hmmm.  Don't like that at all.  The apps seem to be of poor quality, the Youtube app has onscreen directions that don't apply to the Fire TV, the onscreen keyboard is horrible to navigate.  When you get all the way to the end of a list it just stops instead of starting over from the beginning.  There doesn't seem to be anyway to hid items in your Library that you have already watched, making it a pain in the butt to use.  Nope, not too impressed at all, it will be coming back to Amazon shortly.

author: John Van Valkenburg

review: Not so easy to get other TV stations.  It would be easier if there was a drop down menu to select other stations or pay TV web sites.  Typing it in is cumbersome if you want many different channels.  That being said, I am spending much less than the cable neighbors and getting much better quality.  Having less commercials is worth the price.  I haven't figured out yet if I can Tvio yet, but I am very happy to have the Fire TV.  The future of cable networks and constant price hikes are over.  No more monopoly on TV!
